paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant T60A, including penetrance data and individual patient details.

patients.demographics: Median age at diagnosis 65 years (IQR 59.5–66.5), 50% female
patients.phenotype: Mixed cardioneuro phenotype with predominant neuropathy and cardiac manifestations

individual_records.phenotype_details: Neuropathy with carpal tunnel syndrome, autonomic neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The median age at diagnosis was 65 years (IQR 59.5–66.5) and median follow-up 44 months (IQR 31–58).
Overall, a mixed cardioneuro phenotype was demonstrated including autonomic (75%), small (58%) and large fibre (46%) neuropathy.
Clinical manifestations of cardiac disease were frequent at diagnosis and present in 67% of patients.

functional_data.summary: The T60A variant is associated with a mixed cardioneuro phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families; 75% had a family history suggestive of amyloidosis.
variants.population_frequency: 1.1% carrier frequency in the Northwest of Ireland.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the phenotypic spectrum of T60A ATTRv amyloidosis in a contemporary cohort.
key_quotes: A majority (75%) of patients had clinical features of autonomic neuropathy.
Neurological manifestations largely predated cardiac manifestations by median of 7 years.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
